00036 inline void purify_visibility_iuiv2ind(int *ind, int iu, int iv, 
00037                                        int nx, int ny) {
00038 
00039   if (iu >= nx || iv >= ny)
00040     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Visibility index too large.");
00041 
00042   *ind = iu * ny + iv;
00043 
00044 }
00045 
00046 
00058 inline void purify_visibility_ind2iuiv(int *iu, int *iv, int ind, 
00059                                        int nx, int ny) {
00060 
00061   if (ind >= nx*ny)
00062     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Visibility index too large");
00063 
00064   *iu = ind / ny; // Integer division.
00065   *iv = ind - *iu * ny;
00066 
00067 }

00078 inline double purify_visibility_du(double fov) {
00079   return 1.0 / fov;
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00093 inline double purify_visibility_umax(double fov, int n) {
00094   return (double)n / (double)(2.0 * fov);
00095 }

00106 void purify_visibility_alloc(purify_visibility *vis, int nmeas) {
00107 
00108   vis->nmeas = nmeas;
00109   vis->u = (double*)calloc(vis->nmeas, sizeof(double));
00110   vis->v = (double*)calloc(vis->nmeas, sizeof(double));
00111   vis->w = (double*)calloc(vis->nmeas, sizeof(double));
00112   vis->noise_std = (complex double*)calloc(vis->nmeas, 
00113                                            sizeof(complex double));
00114   vis->y = (complex double*)calloc(vis->nmeas, 
00115                                    sizeof(complex double));
00116   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(vis->u);
00117   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(vis->v);
00118   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(vis->w);
00119   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(vis->noise_std);
00120   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(vis->y);
00121 
00122 }

00136 void purify_visibility_copy(purify_visibility *copy, 
00137                             purify_visibility *orig) {
00138 
00139   // Allocate space.
00140   purify_visibility_alloc(copy, orig->nmeas);
00141 
00142   // Copy data.
00143   memcpy(copy->u, orig->u, orig->nmeas*sizeof(double));
00144   memcpy(copy->v, orig->v, orig->nmeas*sizeof(double));
00145   memcpy(copy->w, orig->w, orig->nmeas*sizeof(double));
00146   memcpy(copy->noise_std, orig->noise_std, 
00147          orig->nmeas * sizeof(complex double));
00148   memcpy(copy->y, orig->y, 
00149          orig->nmeas * sizeof(complex double));
00150 
00151 }

00161 void purify_visibility_free(purify_visibility *vis) {
00162 
00163   if(vis->u != NULL) free(vis->u);
00164   if(vis->v != NULL) free(vis->v);
00165   if(vis->w != NULL) free(vis->w);
00166   if(vis->noise_std != NULL) free(vis->noise_std);
00167   if(vis->y != NULL) free(vis->y);
00168   vis->nmeas = 0;
00169 
00170 }

00172 
00185 int purify_visibility_compare(purify_visibility *vis1, 
00186                               purify_visibility *vis2, 
00187                               double tol) {
00188 
00189   int i;
00190 
00191   if (vis1->nmeas != vis2->nmeas)
00192     return 1;
00193 
00194   for (i = 0; i < vis1->nmeas; i++) {
00195 
00196     if (fabs(vis1->u[i] - vis2->u[i]) > tol) return 1;
00197     if (fabs(vis1->v[i] - vis2->v[i]) > tol) return 1;
00198     if (fabs(vis1->w[i] - vis2->w[i]) > tol) return 1;
00199     if (fabs(creal(vis1->noise_std[i] - vis2->noise_std[i])) > tol) 
00200       return 1;
00201     if (fabs(cimag(vis1->noise_std[i] - vis2->noise_std[i])) > tol) 
00202       return 1;
00203     if (fabs(creal(vis1->y[i] - vis2->y[i])) > tol) 
00204       return 1;
00205     if (fabs(cimag(vis1->y[i] - vis2->y[i])) > tol) 
00206       return 1;
00207 
00208   }
00209 
00210   return 0;
00211 }

00228 void purify_visibility_genranmask(purify_sparsemat *mask,
00229                                   int nmeas,
00230                                   int nvis,
00231                                   int seed) {
00232 
00233   int *ivis;
00234 
00235   // Allocate space for visibility indices.
00236   ivis = (int*)malloc(nmeas * sizeof(int));
00237   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ivis);
00238 
00239   // Generate random indices of measured visibilities.
00240   purify_ran_knuthshuffle(ivis, nmeas, nvis, seed);
00241 
00242   // Sort visibility indices.
00243   qsort(ivis, nmeas, sizeof(int), purify_compare_ints);
00244 
00245   // Construct sparse matrix from indices of measured visibilities.
00246   purify_visibility_ivis2mask(mask, ivis, nmeas, nvis);
00247 
00248   // Free memory.
00249   free(ivis);
00250 
00251 }
00252 
00265 void purify_visibility_mask2ivis(int **ivis,
00266                                  purify_sparsemat *mask) {
00267 
00268   int i;
00269   int *v;
00270 
00271   // Allocate space for ivis.
00272   v = (int*)calloc(mask->nvals, sizeof(int));
00273   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(v);
00274   *ivis = v;
00275 
00276   // Compute indices of measured visibilities (i.e. compute ivis).
00277   for (i = 1; i <= mask->ncols; i++) {
00278     if (mask->colptr[i] != mask->colptr[i-1]) {
00279       *v = i-1;
00280       v++;
00281     }
00282   }
00283 
00284 
00285 }

00297 int purify_compare_ints (const void *a, const void *b) {
00298   return ( *(int*)a - *(int*)b );
00299 }

00319 void purify_visibility_mask2vis(purify_visibility *vis,
00320                                 purify_sparsemat *mask,
00321                                 purify_image *img) {
00322 
00323   int *ivis;
00324 
00325   purify_visibility_mask2ivis(&ivis, mask);
00326 
00327   // Compute continuous visibilities.
00328   purify_visibility_ivis2vis(vis, ivis, mask->nvals, img);

00351 void purify_visibility_ivis2mask(purify_sparsemat *mask,
00352                                  int *ivis,
00353                                  int nmeas,
00354                                  int nvis) {
00355 
00356   int i;
00357 
00358   // Sort visibility indices.
00359   qsort(ivis, nmeas, sizeof(int), purify_compare_ints);
00360 
00361   // Construct sparse matrix.
00362   mask->nrows = nmeas;
00363   mask->ncols = nvis;
00364   mask->nvals = nmeas;    
00365 
00366   mask->vals = (double*)malloc(mask->nvals * sizeof(double));
00367   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(mask->vals);
00368   for (i = 0; i < mask->nvals; i++)
00369     mask->vals[i] = 1.0;
00370 
00371   mask->rowind = (int*)malloc(mask->nvals * sizeof(int));
00372   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(mask->rowind);
00373   for (i = 0; i < mask->nvals; i++)
00374     mask->rowind[i] = i;
00375 
00376   mask->colptr = (int*)malloc((mask->ncols+1) * sizeof(int));
00377   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(mask->colptr);
00378   
00379   int *ivisp;
00380   ivisp = ivis;
00381   mask->colptr[0] = 0;
00382   for (i = 1; i < mask->ncols; i++) {
00383     if (i == *ivisp + 1) {
00384       mask->colptr[i] = mask->colptr[i-1] + 1;
00385       ivisp++;
00386     }    
00387     else {
00388       mask->colptr[i] = mask->colptr[i-1];
00389     }
00390   }
00391   mask->colptr[mask->ncols] = mask->nvals;
00392 
00393 }

00395 
00415 void purify_visibility_ivis2vis(purify_visibility *vis,
00416                                 int *ivis,
00417                                 int nmeas,
00418                                 purify_image *img) {
00419 
00420   double du, dv, umax, vmax;
00421   int i, iu, iv;
00422   double epsilon_u, epsilon_v;
00423 
00424   // Sort visibility indices.
00425   qsort(ivis, nmeas, sizeof(int), purify_compare_ints);
00426 
00427   // Check maximum ivis is valid.
00428   if (ivis[nmeas-1] >= (img->nx * img->ny))
00429     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Measured visibility index too large.");
00430 
00431   // Allocate space for visibilities.
00432   purify_visibility_alloc(vis, nmeas);
00433 
00434   // Compute continous visibility coordinates.
00435   du = purify_visibility_du(img->fov_x);
00436   dv = purify_visibility_du(img->fov_y);
00437   umax = purify_visibility_umax(img->fov_x, img->nx);
00438   vmax = purify_visibility_umax(img->fov_y, img->ny);
00439   epsilon_u = du/4.0;
00440   epsilon_v = dv/4.0;
00441     
00442   for (i = 0; i < nmeas; i++) {
00443 
00444     // Get 2D index of visibility.
00445     purify_visibility_ind2iuiv(&iu, &iv, ivis[i], img->nx, img->ny);
00446 
00447     // Compute continuous coordinates.
00448     vis->u[i] = iu * du;
00449     vis->v[i] = iv * dv;
00450     vis->w[i] = 0.0;
00451 
00452     // Map visibilities greater than maximum band-limit to negative
00453     // frequencies.
00454     // Need to subtract an epsilon for the case nx (similarly ny) is
00455     // even.  In this case we want u=umax to be mapped to -umax
00456     // (i.e. we have one more negative frequency than positive
00457     // frequencies).  We can subtact stictly less than du/2 to ensure
00458     // this. For the odd case du/2 will create an additional negative
00459     // frequency hence we choose du/4.
00460     if (vis->u[i] > umax - epsilon_u)
00461       vis->u[i] -= 2*umax;
00462     if (vis->v[i] > vmax - epsilon_v)
00463       vis->v[i] -= 2*vmax;
00464 
00465   }
00466 
00467 }
00468 
00469 
00485 void purify_visibility_snap2grid(purify_visibility *vis,
00486                                  purify_image *img) {
00487 
00488   int i;
00489   double du, dv;
00490 
00491   du = purify_visibility_du(img->fov_x);
00492   dv = purify_visibility_du(img->fov_y);
00493 
00494   for (i = 0; i < vis->nmeas; i++) {    
00495     vis->u[i] = round(vis->u[i] / du) * du;
00496     vis->v[i] = round(vis->v[i] / dv) * dv;
00497   }
00498 
00499 }

00501 
00515 void purify_visibility_vis2mask(purify_sparsemat *mask, 
00516                                 purify_visibility *vis,
00517                                 purify_image *img) {
00518 
00519   int *ivis;
00520   int i, iu, iv, ind;
00521   double du, dv;
00522 
00523   // Allocate space for visibility indices.
00524   ivis = (int*)malloc(vis->nmeas * sizeof(int));
00525   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ivis);
00526 
00527   // Construct array of visibility indices.
00528   du = purify_visibility_du(img->fov_x);
00529   dv = purify_visibility_du(img->fov_y);
00530   for (i = 0; i < vis->nmeas; i++) {
00531 
00532     // Find 2D indices of visibilities.
00533     iu = round(vis->u[i] / du);
00534     iv = round(vis->v[i] / dv);
00535 
00536     // Map negative frequencies to equivalent positive frequency.
00537     iu = (iu < 0 ? iu+img->nx : iu);
00538     iv = (iv < 0 ? iv+img->ny : iv);
00539 
00540     // Compute 1D index from 2D indices.
00541     purify_visibility_iuiv2ind(&ind, iu, iv, 
00542                                img->nx, img->ny);
00543 
00544     // Store 1D visibility index.
00545     ivis[i] = ind;
00546 
00547   }
00548 
00549   // Construct mask from visibility indices.
00550   purify_visibility_ivis2mask(mask, ivis, vis->nmeas, 
00551                               img->nx * img->ny);
00552 
00553   // Free memory.
00554   free(ivis);
00555 
00556 }

00558 
00573 int purify_visibility_readfile(purify_visibility *vis, 
00574                                const char *filename, 
00575                                purify_visibility_filetype filetype) {
00576 
00577 
00578   FILE *file;
00579   char buffer[PURIFY_STRLEN];
00580   int i, nvis, itok;
00581   char *tok;
00582   char delimiters[] = " ,";
00583 
00584   // Open file.
00585   file = fopen(filename, "r");
00586   if (file == NULL) {
00587     sprintf(buffer, "Failed to open file %s", filename);
00588     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC(buffer);
00589   }
00590 
00591   // Read file to count number of visibilities to read.
00592   nvis = 0;
00593   while(fgets(buffer, PURIFY_STRLEN, file) != NULL) {
00594     nvis++;
00595     //puts(buffer);
00596   }
00597 
00598   // Allocate space for visibilities.
00599   purify_visibility_alloc(vis, nvis);
00600 
00601   // Read visibilities.
00602   rewind(file);
00603   switch (filetype) {
00604   case PURIFY_VISIBILITY_FILETYPE_VIS:
00605     i = 0;
00606     while(fgets(buffer, PURIFY_STRLEN, file) != NULL) {
00607       tok = strtok(buffer, delimiters);
00608       itok = 0;
00609       while (tok != NULL) {
00610         switch (itok) {
00611         case 0:
00612           // dummy
00613           break;
00614         case 1:
00615           vis->u[i] = atof(tok);
00616           break;
00617         case 2:
00618           vis->v[i] = atof(tok);
00619           break;
00620         case 3:
00621           vis->w[i] = atof(tok);
00622           break;
00623         case 4:
00624           vis->y[i] = atof(tok);
00625           break;
00626         case 5:
00627           vis->y[i] += I * atof(tok);
00628           break;
00629         case 6:
00630           vis->noise_std[i] = atof(tok);
00631           break;
00632         case 7:
00633           vis->noise_std[i] = I * atof(tok);
00634           break;
00635         default:
00636           break;
00637         }
00638         itok++;
00639         tok = strtok(NULL, delimiters);
00640       }
00641       i++;
00642     }
00643     break;
00644 
00645   case PURIFY_VISIBILITY_FILETYPE_PROFILE_VIS:
00646     i = 0;
00647     while(fgets(buffer, PURIFY_STRLEN, file) != NULL) {
00648       tok = strtok(buffer, delimiters);
00649       itok = 0;
00650       while (tok != NULL) {
00651         switch (itok) {
00652         case 0:
00653           // dummy
00654           break;
00655         case 1:
00656           vis->u[i] = atof(tok);
00657           break;
00658         case 2:
00659           vis->v[i] = atof(tok);
00660           break;
00661         case 3:
00662           vis->y[i] = atof(tok);
00663           break;
00664         case 4:
00665           vis->y[i] += I * atof(tok);
00666           break;
00667         case 5:
00668           vis->noise_std[i] = (1 + I) * atof(tok) / PURIFY_SQRT2;
00669           break;
00670         default:
00671           break;
00672         }
00673         itok++;
00674         tok = strtok(NULL, delimiters);
00675       }
00676       i++;
00677     }
00678     break;
00679 
00680   case PURIFY_VISIBILITY_FILETYPE_PROFILE_WIS:
00681     i = 0;
00682     while(fgets(buffer, PURIFY_STRLEN, file) != NULL) {
00683       tok = strtok(buffer, delimiters);
00684       itok = 0;
00685       while (tok != NULL) {
00686         switch (itok) {
00687         case 0:
00688           // dummy
00689           break;
00690         case 1:
00691           vis->u[i] = atof(tok);
00692           break;
00693         case 2:
00694           vis->v[i] = atof(tok);
00695           break;
00696         case 3:
00697           vis->w[i] = atof(tok);
00698           break;
00699         case 4:
00700           vis->y[i] = atof(tok);
00701           break;
00702         case 5:
00703           vis->y[i] += I * atof(tok);
00704           break;
00705         case 6:
00706           vis->noise_std[i] = (1 + I) * atof(tok) / PURIFY_SQRT2;
00707           break;
00708         default:
00709           break;
00710         }
00711         itok++;
00712         tok = strtok(NULL, delimiters);
00713       }
00714       i++;
00715     }
00716     break;
00717     
00718   default:
00719     sprintf(buffer, 
00720             "Visibility filetype with id %d is not supported", 
00721             filetype);
00722     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC(buffer);
00723     break;
00724 
00725   }
00726 
00727   // Close file.
00728   fclose(file);
00729 
00730   return 0;
00731 
00732 }

00734 
00745 int purify_visibility_writefile(purify_visibility *vis, 
00746                                 const char *filename, 
00747                                 purify_visibility_filetype filetype) {
00748 
00749 
00750   FILE *file;
00751   char buffer[PURIFY_STRLEN];
00752   int i;
00753 
00754   // Open file.
00755   file = fopen(filename, "w");
00756   if (file == NULL) {
00757     sprintf(buffer, "Failed to create file %s", filename);
00758     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC(buffer);
00759   }
00760 
00761   // Write file.
00762   switch (filetype) {
00763 
00764   case PURIFY_VISIBILITY_FILETYPE_VIS:
00765     for (i = 0; i < vis->nmeas; i++)
00766       fprintf(file, " %d %.10f %.10f %.10f %.10e %.10e %.10e %.10e\n", 
00767               i+1, 
00768               vis->u[i], vis->v[i], vis->w[i],
00769               creal(vis->y[i]), cimag(vis->y[i]), 
00770               creal(vis->noise_std[i]), cimag(vis->noise_std[i])) ;
00771     break;
00772 
00773   case PURIFY_VISIBILITY_FILETYPE_PROFILE_VIS:
00774     for (i = 0; i < vis->nmeas; i++)
00775       fprintf(file, " %d %.4f %.4f %.7e %.7e %.7e\n", 
00776               i+1, 
00777               vis->u[i], vis->v[i], 
00778               creal(vis->y[i]), cimag(vis->y[i]), 
00779               cabs(vis->noise_std[i]));
00780     break;
00781 
00782   case PURIFY_VISIBILITY_FILETYPE_PROFILE_WIS:
00783     for (i = 0; i < vis->nmeas; i++)
00784       fprintf(file, " %d %.4f %.4f %.4f %.7e %.7e %.7e\n", 
00785               i+1, 
00786               vis->u[i], vis->v[i], vis->w[i],
00787               creal(vis->y[i]), cimag(vis->y[i]), 
00788               cabs(vis->noise_std[i]));
00789     break;
00790 
00791   default:
00792     sprintf(buffer, 
00793             "Visibility filetype with id %d is not supported", 
00794             filetype);
00795     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC(buffer);
00796 
00797     break;
00798   }
00799 
00800   // Close file.
00801   fclose(file);
00802 
00803   return 0;
00804 
00805 }
00806 
00807 
00821 double purify_visibility_modifypdf(double *pdf, double *new_pdf, 
00822                                    int num_elements, int nb_meas, 
00823                                    int max_iter)
00824 {
00825   double alpha=0;
00826   double alpha_min=-1;
00827   double alpha_max=1;
00828   int i;
00829   double max_pdf;
00830   double M;
00831   int iter=0;
00832         
00833   // Normalize the pdf profile
00834   max_pdf=purify_utils_maxarray(pdf, num_elements);
00835         
00836   for (i=0; i<num_elements; i++)
00837     {
00838       pdf[i]=pdf[i]/max_pdf;
00839     }   
00840         
00841   // Find alpha to get the desired number of measurements.      
00842   while (iter<max_iter) {
00843     alpha=(alpha_min+alpha_max)/2;
00844     M=0;
00845     for (i=0; i<num_elements; i++)
00846       {
00847         new_pdf[i]=pdf[i]+alpha;
00848         if (new_pdf[i]>1) {
00849           new_pdf[i]=1;
00850         }
00851         if (new_pdf[i]<0) {
00852           new_pdf[i]=0;
00853         }
00854         M=M+round(new_pdf[i]);
00855       }
00856     if (M>nb_meas) {
00857       alpha_max=alpha;
00858     }
00859     else if (M<nb_meas){
00860       alpha_min=alpha;
00861     }
00862     else {
00863       break;
00864     }
00865 
00866     iter++;
00867   }
00868   return alpha;
00869 }
00870 
00871 
00900 int purify_visibility_vdsmask(purify_sparsemat *mask, purify_image *img, 
00901                               double p, int nmeas_tol, 
00902                               int maxiter_pdf, int maxiter_nmeas, 
00903                               int seed) {
00904 
00905   int num_el;
00906   int i, j, ind;
00907   int nmeas_req, nmeas;
00908   double alpha=-1;
00909   int iter=0;
00910   double d=1;
00911   double *r, *x, *y, *tmp;
00912   double dx, dy;
00913   double *pdf, *new_pdf;
00914   int *ivis;
00915   int N, M, Mon2;
00916 
00917   // Inialise sizes.
00918   N = img->nx;
00919   M = img->ny;
00920   num_el=N*M;
00921   nmeas_req=(int)round(p*num_el);
00922         
00923   // Check p<1.
00924   if (p >= 1 || p <= 0)
00925     PURIFY_ERROR_GENERIC("Require coverage percentage 0<p<1 in VDS");
00926 
00927   // Allocate space for the x grid.
00928   x = (double*)malloc(N * sizeof(double));
00929   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(x);
00930         
00931   // Allocate space for the y grid.
00932   y = (double*)malloc(M * sizeof(double));
00933   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(y);
00934         
00935   // Allocate space for the polar grid.
00936   r = (double*)malloc(num_el * sizeof(double));
00937   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(r);
00938         
00939   // Allocate space for pdf profile.
00940   pdf = (double*)malloc(num_el * sizeof(double));
00941   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(pdf);
00942         
00943   // Allocate space for the new pdf profile.
00944   new_pdf = (double*)malloc(num_el * sizeof(double));
00945   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(new_pdf);
00946         
00947   // Construct cartesian grid centred on zero.
00948   dx=2.0/(double)(N-1);
00949   dy=2.0/(double)(M-1); 
00950   x[0]=-1;
00951   for (i=1; i<N; i++)
00952     x[i]=x[i-1]+dx;
00953   y[0]=-1;
00954   for (i=1; i<M; i++)
00955     y[i]=y[i-1]+dy;
00956 
00957   // iFftshift cartesian grid.
00958   tmp = (double*)malloc(N * sizeof(double));
00959   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(tmp);
00960   purify_utils_ifftshift_1d(tmp, x, N);
00961   memcpy(x, tmp, N*sizeof(double));
00962   free(tmp);
00963   tmp = (double*)malloc(M * sizeof(double));
00964   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(tmp);
00965   purify_utils_ifftshift_1d(tmp, y, M);
00966   memcpy(y, tmp, M*sizeof(double));
00967   free(tmp);
00968 
00969   // Generate polar grid.
00970   for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00971     for (j=0; j<M; j++)
00972       r[i+N*j]=sqrt(x[i]*x[i]+y[j]*y[j]);
00973 
00974   // Find d of the pdf profile to, on average, give the desired number
00975   // of samples.
00976   iter = 0;
00977   do {
00978     //Initialize the pdf profile
00979     for (i=0; i<num_el; i++)
00980       pdf[i]=pow(1-r[i],d);
00981 
00982     alpha = purify_visibility_modifypdf(pdf, new_pdf, 
00983                                         num_el, nmeas_req, 
00984                                         maxiter_nmeas);
00985     if (alpha<0)
00986       d=d+0.1;
00987     else
00988       d=d-0.1;
00989     iter++;    
00990   } while ( (abs(alpha)>0.01) && (iter<maxiter_pdf));
00991 
00992   // Construct indicies of measured visibilities.
00993   ivis = (int*)calloc(M*N, sizeof(int));
00994   PURIFY_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ivis);
00995   purify_ran_ran2(-abs(seed));  
00996   iter = 0;
00997   do {
00998     ind = 0;
00999     Mon2 = (int)ceil(M/2.0 - 1.0);
01000     for (i=0; i<N; i++) 
01001       for (j=0; j<Mon2; j++) 
01002         if (i!=0 || j!=0) // Ignore dc component.
01003           if (purify_ran_ran2(abs(seed))<new_pdf[i+N*j])
01004             ivis[ind++] = i + N*j;
01005     nmeas = ind;
01006     iter++;
01007   } while (abs(nmeas - nmeas_req) > nmeas_tol && iter < maxiter_nmeas);
01008 
01009   // Construct sparse matrix representation of mask.
01010   purify_visibility_ivis2mask(mask, ivis, nmeas, num_el);
01011         
01012   // Free tempory memory.
01013   free(x);
01014   free(y);
01015   free(r);
01016   free(pdf);
01017   free(new_pdf);
01018   free(ivis);
01019 
01020   return nmeas;
01021                 
01022 }
Generated on Thu Aug 8 2013 12:52:49 by   1.7.6.1
